alert.note: Alert for Allegan; Mason; Muskegon; Oceana; Ottawa; Van Buren (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 12 at 10:34AM EDT until September 12 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...High wave action, strong currents, and dangerous swimming conditions expected. Piers may be heavily swamped by waves. * WHERE...Mason, Oceana, Muskegon, Ottawa, Allegan and Van Buren counties. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Strong currents can pull swimmers into deeper water and high waves can sweep people off piers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Dangerous swim conditions will continue into this afternoon. Stay dry when waves are high!. Waves, as of 1030 am this morning were in the 4 to 6 foot range and maximum wave heights were reported to still be near 8 feet. The wind and waves will slowly subside through the afternoon and should return to safe levels by late afternoon.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions and do not venture out on piers. Please check with your local authorities on potential beach closures.

area.areaDesc: Allegan; Mason; Muskegon; Oceana; Ottawa; Van Buren
